articles.description: Reaction as Arsenal hammer Chelsea 5-0 in the Premier League to go three points clear at the top of the table, plus build-up to four matches on Wednesday, including Everton v Liverpool.
articles.title: Reaction: Arsenal clear in Premier League title-race after big win over Chelsea

articles.description: Liverpool are set to open talks with Feyenoord over Arne Slot becoming Jurgen Klopp's successor.
articles.title: Liverpool manager search: Feyenoord's Arne Slot set for talks to succeed Jurgen Klopp

articles.description: Two Premier League footballers are arrested in connection with an alleged rape.
articles.title: Premier League: Two players arrested over alleged rape

articles.description: Watch live BBC coverage of the World Snooker Championship 2024 at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield.
articles.title: World Snooker Championship 2024 LIVE: Wilson vs Dale, Ding vs Lisowski

articles.description: Former West Ham, Manchester United and Manchester City striker Carlos Tevez is admitted to hospital after suffering chest pains.
articles.title: Carlos Tevez: Former Man Utd, Man City, West Ham star in hospital

articles.description: Kai Havertz could be the man to deliver Arsenal the Premier League title after starring against Chelsea, writes Phil McNulty.
articles.title: Kai Havertz: Arsenal forward stars in win over Chelsea

articles.description: Seven-time world champion Ronnie O’Sullivan does not think he is the greatest snooker player of all time, even as he bids for a record eighth Crucible title.
articles.title: Ronnie O'Sullivan: I'm not the greatest snooker player ever

articles.description: Luka Doncic scores 32 points to help the Dallas Mavericks to a 96-93 win to level their play-off series against the Los Angeles Clippers at 1-1.
articles.title: NBA play-offs 2024: Donkic stars as Mavericks level series with Clippers

articles.description: BBC Sport finds out what drives interim Watford manager Tom Cleverley, the former Manchester United and England midfielder.
articles.title: Watford's Tom Cleverley 'has more ambition as coach than player'

articles.description: The story of England's victory against the odds in the largely overlooked 1994 Rugby World Cup final.
articles.title: Rugby World Cup: England's first world champions in 1994
